MajorClaims.MC1: people who can't accept others' criticism can't succeed in group working
MajorClaims.MC2: criticism is essential especially in group working but in other occasions we still need criticism

Claims.C1: the core of group working is "consensus"
Claims.C2: Even if you are not working in a group, you still need to take others' criticism
Claims.C3: even if you are right, criticism is still helpful

Premises.P1: the work belongs to every member, not a personal show for specific one member
Premises.P2: It doesn't work if one member solely insists on his/her idea and doesn't take other member's criticism
Premises.P3: It's every member's duty to respect other's opinion
Premises.P4: It's the idea that everyone’s opinion accounts
Premises.P5: In group works, group members gather together to have brain-storming discussion, think over every possible solutions and then finally reach an agreement
Premises.P7: it points out your drawbacks and forces you to confront them
Premises.P8: criticism can help you detect those drawbacks and fix them if you are willing to take it
Premises.P9: taking criticism is a virtue as you take someone's opinion that is against you
Premises.P10: Those who don't even take a word of criticism will eventually lose chances to get improved
Premises.P11: if you can't take any criticism, not only will you fail in cooperating with other people, but also get defeated in personal works
Premises.P12: As one Chinese idiom goes: "The good medicine tastes bitter“
Premises.P13: Criticism might be the most powerful solution to heal
Premises.P14: in this case it not only is a fixer, but it also serves as a practice to test you how much you know about your work
Premises.P15: Taking criticism doesn't necessary mean that you have to take it all
Premises.P16: You should have your own judgments too
Premises.P17: And it's kind of art to make the best use of criticism
